lexUnit.name: gasp.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: catch one's breath with an open mouth, owing to pain or astonishment

sentence.text: I came up into the air gasping deeply , panting , aching lungs swelling , feeling a rush of suppressed terror , clinging onto the curtain in a shaky state .
The woman gasped and then called after me but I would n't stop .
Twigs hindered him as he gasped and struggled backward out of the thicket , which felt all at once like a trap .
The other prisoners gasped because they expected him to be shot on the spot .
She gasped as he yanked her closer .
Constance gasped as they reached the door of the apartment .
She gasped as Nicolo reached out and caught her by the shoulders .
He frowned as the waiter hesitated , then gasped with shock as the man , his nerve gone , fled away from the room .
Thessy gasped at such blasphemy , while I scowled at Ellen 's blackmail .
She gasped in amazement .
She looked at the baby and gasped with surprise .

At summer temperatures the major water quality problem is due to a lack of dissolved oxygen which results in the fish gasping at the water surface , showing rapid gill movements and , in severe cases , dying .
She gasped at the sight of the blood beginning to cake under his nose .
He let out a deep , hungry growl as she bucked and gasped from the shocking sensation , her eyes like a frightened doe 's .
The icy stream took her breath away and she gasped as the water poured through her hair and ran down her face .
They walked out of the warm lobby and gasped , both of them , as the December wind whipped down the street and slapped them into the open air .
The Villa Faalifu was set on the edge of Tala-Tala , and the sight of its opulent exterior almost left me gasping .
He took her by the shoulders suddenly , his expression so fierce that Robyn gasped .
It was like a douse of cold water , cutting through the lingering remains of passion , and Fran gasped .
Laura gasped , the blood seeming to rush through her veins with a new , heady warmth .
